Line 284: Line 284:
An explosion also occurred on the [[Arab Gas Pipeline]] in the Sinai at a gas pipeline to Israel and Jordan after saboteurs were believed to have responded to a call by Islamist groups to exploit the unrest. Supplies were expected to be cut for a week.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://af.reuters.com/article/egyptNews/idAFLDE71408C20110205 |title=UPDATE 1-Jordan gas supplies to be halted a week after blast |publisher=Reuters|date=2009-02-09 |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref>
An explosion also occurred on the [[Arab Gas Pipeline]] in the Sinai at a gas pipeline to Israel and Jordan after saboteurs were believed to have responded to a call by Islamist groups to exploit the unrest. Supplies were expected to be cut for a week.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://af.reuters.com/article/egyptNews/idAFLDE71408C20110205 |title=UPDATE 1-Jordan gas supplies to be halted a week after blast |publisher=Reuters|date=2009-02-09 |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref>
â
There were some reports that Mubarak resigned as head of the ruling NDP party,<ref>{{cite web|author=Mike Dowling |url=http://www.thejournal.ie/mubarak-focuses-on-economic-issues-as-protests-continue-2011-02/ |title=Protests continue in Egypt as NDP leadership resigns Â· TheJournal |publisher=Thejournal.ie |date=2010-09-23 |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> however these reports were later denied by State Television and the Information minister.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hossam Badrawi replaces NDP's Secretary general Safwat El Sherif and Gamal Mubarak|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/5039.aspx|accessdate=6 February 2011|newspaper=Al Ahram Online|date=5 February 2011}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|title=Information Minister denies Mubarak's resignation from ruling party|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/311088|accessdate=6 February 2011|newspaper=Al Masry Al Youm|date=6 February 2011}}</ref> State television announced the appointment of [[Hossam Badrawi]] as Head of the Shura Council after [[Safwat El-Sherif]]'s resignation from his position within the party. Mubarak's son [[Gamal Mubarak|Gamal]] also resigned as Assistant Secretary and Secretary of the Policy Committee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/02/05/136363.html |title=Ø¥ÙØµØ§Ø¡ Ø¬ÙØ§Ù ÙØ§ÙØ´Ø±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙÙØ·ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØµØ±Ù.. ÙØªØ¹ÙÙÙ Ø¨Ø¯Ø±Ø§ÙÙ Ø£ÙÙÙØ§ |publisher=Alarabiya.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> Minister of State for Legal Affairs Mufid Shehab and Presidential Chief-of-Staff Zakaria Azmy were also dismissed from the party.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/ndp-overhaul-meager-concession-says-opposition |title=NDP overhaul a meager concession, says opposition | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> However, the opposition leaders continued to seek ways to remove Mubarak from power. They called on the protesters to continue at Tahrir Square every Tuesday and Friday until Mubarak "resigns and makes true the demands of the people."<ref name="CNN 5 Feb"/>
+
There were some reports that Mubarak resigned as head of the ruling NDP party,<ref>{{cite web|author=Mike Dowling |url=http://www.thejournal.ie/mubarak-focuses-on-economic-issues-as-protests-continue-2011-02/ |title=Protests continue in Egypt as NDP leadership resigns Â· TheJournal |publisher=Thejournal.ie |date=2010-09-23 |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> however these reports were later denied by State Television and the Information minister.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hossam Badrawi replaces NDP's Secretary general Safwat El Sherif and Gamal Mubarak|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/5039.aspx|accessdate=6 February 2011|newspaper=Al Ahram Online|date=5 February 2011}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|title=Information Minister denies Mubarak's resignation from ruling party|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/311088|accessdate=6 February 2011|newspaper=Al Masry Al Youm|date=6 February 2011}}</ref> State television announced the appointment of [[Hossam Badrawi]] as Head of the Shura Council after [[Safwat El-Sherif]]'s resignation from his position within the party. Mubarak's son [[Gamal Mubarak|Gamal]] also resigned as Assistant Secretary and Secretary of the Policy Committee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/02/05/136363.html |title=Ø¥ÙØµØ§Ø¡ Ø¬ÙØ§Ù ÙØ§ÙØ´Ø±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙÙØ·ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØµØ±Ù.. ÙØªØ¹ÙÙÙ Ø¨Ø¯Ø±Ø§ÙÙ Ø£ÙÙÙØ§ |publisher=Alarabiya.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> Minister of State for Legal Affairs Mufid Shehab and Presidential Chief-of-Staff Zakaria Azmy were also dismissed from the party.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/ndp-overhaul-meager-concession-says-opposition |title=NDP overhaul a meager concession, says opposition | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Former Interior Minister ''Habib el-Adli'' and three of his leadership have been put under house arrest. There had been reports about the arrest of a number of other security leaders who are currently being held in a military prison<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egyptâs-attorney-general-bans-former-ministers-and-officials-travel|title=Egyptâs attorney-general bans former ministers and officials from travel|publisherAlmasry Alyoum|date= |accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>. However, the opposition leaders continued to seek ways to remove Mubarak from power. They called on the protesters to continue at Tahrir Square every Tuesday and Friday until Mubarak "resigns and makes true the demands of the people."<ref name="CNN 5 Feb"/>
